snippets: Opioid use commonly causes constipation. First‑line treatment is a stimulant laxative such as senna; add a stool‑softener (e.g. docusate) if stools remain hard. Continue prophylactically while opioid therapy continues. (NICE CKS: Opioid‑induced constipation, 2023)
For chronic low‑back pain, review long‑term opioid efficacy regularly and consider dose tapering and multimodal non‑pharmacological therapies. (NICE NG59, 2023)
